QRYOvwwCT9xcLIVmII2RWw.text: I'm part of a dinner club that reviews restaurants around Charlotte, and Enat was our pick for the month. No one else in the group had ever experienced Ethiopian food, so this was my pick! The food was amazing: a few people were even eating foods they had placed on their "don't eat list" like lamb and beet. The service was excellent. It's a family owned business we were served by the owner who made great recommendations for an authentic experience. Her mother performed a coffee ceremony after the meal that was so enjoyable while her dad told us stories and shared culture. We'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Coffee ceremony with the enat (mother) of the restaurant.
Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gored gored
Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegetable combo

qea3ihkBIidjJBBrYkMJrg.text: First time trying Ethiopian food and it was great! So flavorful! I had the lamb, chickpea stew, raw beef, and cabbage. They even had ceremonial coffee. I was greeted with warmth and it continued and showed throughout my service. I'll definitely be back for more!

s5MUBMPoOp1gAkRtWLKdSA.text: Great experience! Very welcoming environment, delicious food, great service, happy people. We'll definitely return. Don't forget to try the coffee and please don't add cream or sugar!

W3OSiHP3WYVY_EFdC_0HJw.text: Fantastic!! Everything we ate on the vegetarian combo was top notch. Service and decor were similar; humbly tasteful. Very cool authentic looking (I am no expert) Ethiopian art in a simple, colorful cafe environment. The food was so good we decided to take another veg combo to go. Highly recommend this spot to lovers of exotic food.

FBNGtozzkx6dyLhJECZbIg.text: Never had Ethiopian food but this was very good! Highly recommend it for anyone that has eaten it before Wise never tried it very good spot

1Lm2JQUcnSCQYuU5Z2MrHg.text: First time ever eating Ethiopian... and it was amazing!  The food was delicious and plentiful!  My wife and kids loved it too!  Great place for vegetarians like us!

AHSp8-Xtxx8BdCoqLJjwAg.text: It was cold and I was lazy so I got food from Enat delivered via Postmates. It came fast and everything was at the right temp and delicious. Since it was my first order I tried a few things -- awaze lamb tibs, with fasolia (green beans and carrots) and the beet and potato side added on. Plus some extra injera, because who doesn't need extra injera?  That's definitely enough for two full on meals so don't get carried away with your order unless you like leftovers. The awaze tibs was super flavorful and spicy but not overpowering. The beet and potato was really good -- I've never seen that dish at an Ethiopian place before but it is my new favorite. The injera was springy and fresh, probably some of the best I've had in this town. Only complaint is that the container let the ater mix completely with the awaze tibs because the delivery person didn't keep it flat, but it was delicious anyway. I can only imagine it will be much better right out of the kitchen.

4r-x2i7VhwmNw-iynEYYyw.text: Best Ethiopian food in Charlotte!!! I had the vegetable platter and everything on it was very flavorful and fresh. The Tomoato Fit Fit and the lentil salads were very interesting and some had flavors that were new to me.The warm veggies were really good as well, especially the collards and the carrot and bean mix. The injera bread was best I ever had. It was soft and tasted a bit like a good sourdough bread. The service was outstanding too. Very friendly and very willing to explain anything on the menu or even how to eat with the injera bread. The best part was the complimentary coffee they served us at the end of the meal. The roasted fresh Ethiopian coffee beans right in front of you, then ground them and made a fresh coffee served like an espresso. The coffee was a perfect ending to the meal. I highly recommend you try Enat. Even if you do not live nearby, it is worth the drive to go there.

photos.caption: Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegetable platter with injera bread in the middle.

vmutY0tcO-et4dshrUJO-g.text: The food was plentiful and delicious!  The atmosphere was warm and inviting.  The waitress, knowing this was our first time, was so kind, she explained everything, gave recommendations and made our experience very enjoyable.  We had the vegetable platter and beef tibs, both were very good!  We look forward to going back soon!

dkUNoU8CTL9EukcnOAW87A.text: Omg!! You have to come and check this place out! The Kitfo Quesadilla and Chicken Tibs with Gomen(collard greens) were bomb!!! Please check this spot out ASAP!!! The restaurant is in a shopping center but once you walk in it feels like you've travelled across the world to Ethiopia and are immersed in the culture. The restaurant has such a nice vibe and is cozy and quaint! The smells of wonderfully seasoned food mixed with Ethiopian music really help to add to the experience! The staff were super knowledgeable and very friendly. There's a really cool dictionary on the side of the menu that describes what the different foods are. It's a very nice touch!! Tina (the owner) greeted us with a smile and took the time to explain the different dishes and answer our questions. She also made sure to stop by the table to check and see how we were enjoying the meal. This was truly a wonderful experience ! But hey you don't have to take my word for it. Go see for yourself!!

suV77SxoEwmiaZcArPD-bA.text: Charlotte now has several Ethiopian restaurants, and I've been to most of them. But I must say, Enat's is my favorite and now my go-to Ethiopian spot because the food is outstanding, the service is attentive, the location is convenient for those of us who spend a lot of time on Central Ave, and the ambiance is bright and warm. Enat's Special was delicious. I plan to come back for their brunch.

xUl005szX3g1qJ0VPJrmmw.text: This place is amazing!! Everything is Great! I've tried it all! You won't be disappointed.

5XEPwokmAUCZ1hKozXFI-g.text: I was immensely impressed and satisfied with the food and services at this restaurant. Their fish tibs is one of my favorite. It's cooked perfectly and goes well with their rice as well as enjera. Definitely a must try.

photos.caption: Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fish Tibs

1dfMRZDFfWhE2mjT53CXOg.text: Amazingly authentic Ethiopian cuisine!! Great service, very clean. Great for Vegans too! Very well seasoned with all the trimmings.

photos.caption: Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu
Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. This is the Vegetarian Combo!

vhQQDhKllFe3fFmcH4wSpw.text: Excellent food, cooked from scratch. A family restaurant, Ethiopian food, healthy, tasty. The service was very personalized and intimate. A great discovery for people who like to taste something new, although I am sure after you trying anybody would go back again and again. Delicious!

MJ7JrD-lkVMn7UWj80swEw.text: Last night's dining experience was amazing! The owner took the time to welcome us and break down the menu. This was my first time experiencing Ethiopian cuisine. I ordered the vegetarian combo with beef on the side. It was very good and I loved all the spicyness...fresh jalapenos in everything The owner was very helpful in explaining the menu and the service was excellent despite our large group. Everything is made to order and fresh when placed in front of you. All in all, it was a great dining experience.

Or-Rj9Ocz3LKBIv7pm1SCA.text: The food here is delicious and the staff are awesome and very accommodating. It's both a good thing and a bad thing that it takes me half an hour to drive here. If they were closer to me I would be eating here all the time.

Cpyj4fBb1FcfPx7yOqKGDQ.text: I've never eaten Ethiopian food before, so when my friend suggested it as our monthly foodie adventure, I figured why not?  There were 15 of us. The staff was courteous and arranged seating to accommodate us. I chose the lamb tibs, shiro stew and enjera. The lamb was cooked to perfection. The sauce is a blend of special spices and seasonings with diced tomatoes, onions & jalepenos. The shiro stew was fantastic. I'm a big fan of chickpeas and this didn't disappoint. The enjera was spongey and slightly bitter. If it was seasoned, it would take away from the complexities of the food. It's a small family business, so I wasn't even upset that my food came out WAY after everyone else's (there were 15 of us). The highlight was Enat (mother) fixing coffee for us. The ceremony was interesting to watch and the aroma from the beans filled the restaurant with a pleasant, smokey ambiance. I'll definitely return, just without 14 other people!

photos.caption: Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Our party was treated to coffee.
Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Deliciousness...lamb tibs and shiro stew

d1FxeyQACQ9V-afITWvCbg.text: Enat is amazing, the best Ethiopian food I've had in Charlotte.  Tina, who is the general manager here, came to our table and gave us a great education on Ethiopian food, as well as their coffee traditions.  We need to go back to check out a coffee ceremony, it sounded delicious and fun.  I would highly recommend the Gored Gored which was a crispy beef dish, and GET THE ENJERA!  Not sure how they do theirs, but it was done to perfection and left me craving more.

NVV3oBbZx_kvWLxkc8R5ag.text: I am staying in an Airbnb place nearby and Enat is the closest restaurant so I figured I'd give it a try. I don't know much about Ethiopian food so I kept my order simple and ordered the lamb sandwich and an order of tikel gomen, which I looked up on Google...it's a cabbage dish which is really tasty and almost reminds of something Eastern European. The sandwich itself was really excellent! It came in a nice hoagie roll with a delicious side salad. Now I want to do some more adventures in Ethiopian food.

Hz3tKVXWMLSVTKpkQiWoJA.text: Love this new Ethiopian cuisine in the Charlotte area! The staff is super friendly, welcoming and attentive to their guests! I throughly enjoyed my experience when I visited a few weeks ago. I highly recommend trying the kitfo Rolls and Goden Tibs! I'll be sure to frequent this establishment and hope they are here for the long haul!

photos.caption: Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kitfo Rolls, Injera sautéd in Ethiopian spiced butter

sI77OF6A5MfWlhI5bbEezg.text: Great food. 1st time having Ethiopian. Staff/owners very nice and explained all menu items. Location is clean and we were seated and served promptly. Will return. Had the vegetarian plate everything was so flavorful.

photos.caption: Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegetarian plate.

HaaHbWoJyloh_b7EBF6q7g.text: Went here the other week with my friend for lunch! The place looks very standoff-ish from the outside but once you walk in, the place is clean and cozy. The guy working there was super friendly and the food was delicious! We got the veggie sampler platter with beef and it was so good! I will definitely be coming back when I am craving ethiopian food =)

RwscuIX4xlS1oVz1lKlGYw.text: Enat is one of the best restaurants in Charlotte. I have eaten here many times and tried much of the menu. You cannot go wrong. The service is also great.

hZqf_mML0mgVyvDojrz6HA.text: Really good food prepared at a family own restaurant! This was my first experience eating Ethiopian food. I really appreciated the owner coming out to explain the cuisine and cultural way of dining :-) Given eating with my hands was a bit new to me, I was happy to see silverware offered if I really wanted it. The chicken tibs is definitely a favorite!

photos.caption: Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ethiopian cuisine (definitiions)
Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ethiopian cuisine (definitiions)
Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Traditional way of preparing coffee

nnXl9wXlu9aAtRUw0PNoEQ.text: I found Enat through Yelp and got takeout. It was great! Fantastic service, great food.

PpSUvhq2uM9TNsClAPVnog.text: Wow so amazing. Waitress very helpful and friendly. Coffee was so amazing and incense brought out with coffee smelled wonderful. Everything we ordered was wonderful you can't go wrong.

oGZbi22Jgj3MJ55J0I8vzg.text: Nice staff, however, I ordered Gomen and it was completely bland. No spices. I didn't go out for Ethiopian food to get tasteless food! Very disappointed to be eating super plain greens.

RBaCkAM7tmkVU9Lekrit9w.text: I loved this little place. The staff was wonderful. The food was authentic and the flavors were great. I would definitely go here again.

H8lkDRKxzaG2_QUx8CcqjA.text: I happened to be in Charlotte for the holidays. I did a quick search for Ethiopian food and found my way to Enat. Really great food. I ordered the veg. combo as a carry-out order. I will definitely visit again.

photos.caption: Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

nykpxcAzce_dsEmQj3HKjw.text: I have been to a number of Ethiopian restaurants in Charlotte and prior to coming to Enat, I was ready to give up on the cuisine.  This place is, by far, the best Ethiopian food that I have tried.   The space is very small and unassuming, but clean and neatly decorated.  It is in a little shopping complex off of Plaza.  The menu is smallish, but in a nice touch they give definitions of many of the Ethiopian terms.  There is a cooler in the front with juice, water, and sodas  - no alcohol is sold.  It seemed like the person serving us was an owner/manager as she knew everything about the food and even the Armhaic letters on the wall.  The service was quick as the restaurant was empty when we arrived.  My wife had Kifto 360 which was some sort of spiced meat patty with cream cheese pressed between two tortillas and sliced like a pie.  She absolutely loved it.  As a main dish I had the lamb nibs, while my wife had the vegetarian platter.  Everything came out on one plate, with a side dish of rolled up enjera (slightly sour, spongy bread that you use to pick up the food in lieu of utensils.)  The lamb nibs were excellent and I liked the green beans and cabbage and carrots as well from the vegetarian platter.  The vegetarian platter had 8 different combos so it is great to sample from. Everything was just a touch spicy which was great.  The prices were not super cheap, but very reasonable both for the quality and quantity of food that we got. I would definitely go back.

L7JxC7OLRAIm9QbAUazIQg.text: My partner and I recently moved to the Charlotte area, and we love Ethiopian food. We were so happy with our experience at Enat. We split the vegetarian platter for two (it was huge). The meal included a great variety of items (cold and warm). The service was excellent and the place was cozy. We will definitely be back!

mazEGZ8e5vSixP2bKejKag.text: Great service and great food. Can't go wrong. I got the veggie platter and it was delicious. It could probably be split by two people. Good food!

photos.caption: Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

RgTYjyj7aPs92w_fjNiFHg.text: First time eating Ethiopian we were welcomed by the wonderful owner Tina who's mom helped her open. The food was amazing. Love that you eat with your hands and no silverware. Tried St George's Beer that was delicious. This restaurant is a gift to North Carolina. Authentic and delicious Ethiopian food. Yum! In a sea of chain restaurants this place is a shining star. We will be back.

8pxLrV3iK4xhaU6gWdk-vg.text: I love this place! Great customer service and the food is prepared fresh and fast!   Try the vegetarian plate! A must try

HHPeZ3KdRvPPB0QsUldCXg.text: Amazing food! In from NYC where we're spoiled with plenty of great Ethiopian food and this place beats them all! Plus, the owner is an angel. Support family run restaurants. Eat. Here. Soon!

vnAYlFPHzaQvPuJf0Bw17Q.text: I really enjoyed this first time visit here. When we arrived at 6:30 on a Saturday night, we were the only ones here. It soon became very busy and all the table were full within a matter of 30 minutes and it's obvious why. The food was excellent and the service was personable and friendly. I very much enjoyed the veggie platter which came with an endless amount of injera (spongy like bread). The meal was large and enough for 2 people with smaller appetites. I will be back.

RnhMXt2m9tc9BMI2o29_3w.text: I order at least once a week. Can't get enough of the Tikel Gomen & chicken sambusas! Food is ALWAYS HOT, FRESH, & TASTY! Owners and employees are always so friendly! Eat in or order your experience will always amount to enjoying authentic Ethiopian food.

xvP4f9fBMiqmKM8j9BRb3Q.text: So good.  This location is a bit out of the way for many charlotteans, but it is worth the effort.  The food is delicious, and presented beautifully.  The owner is very helpful, friendly, and welcoming.  There are several humble, tasty Ethiopian places in town, but this one is my new favorite.

nzUkRXqUU7EA217dPEJ3AA.text: Today was my first experience with Ethiopian food, and it did not disappoint! I had the chicken tibs, and the vegetarian platter. Split with a friend and we both still took leftovers home! Great amount of food for the price, and the coffee was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

YSv19IuqQqqqG8tabFptqg.text: This was my first Ethiopian restaurant experience and i loved it ! The food was delicious and the owner was so helpful and sweet . I ordered some lamb and fossolia and my boyfriend ordered the Doro Wat and Gomen . We also had some cinnamon tea , which was delightful . Everything is made by hand of course and fresh. I would recommend this place to anyone

photos.caption: Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

bWJO9hIW9bolnjtNVgnH8g.text: Very first time trying Ethiopian cuisine, but will most definitely not be my last. My wife and I knew nothing about this type of food and the young lady working there was very patient explaining everything to us as well as making some great recommendations as to what we should try based on our likes. We had the chicken tibs and the vegetarian combo to get a sample of most everything. Everything was super fresh and absolutely delicious! If I could give more than five stars I would. The service could not have been more prompt, attentive and friendly. The food was amazing!

eQetqN23O8EJEVA0Xnpu8g.text: I've eaten  here twice now and they have consistently  great food. The vegetarian combo is absolutely delicious, and the meat dishes I've tried are as well. There are a few Ethiopian  restaurants in the area, and this one is for sure up there with the best.

s7E2tAg2asj7FTzXI6vd1g.text: The food is absolutely delicious.  Vegan dish, chicken ribs, and stew. This will be my new place for vegetables when I'm in town.

gPoP4Ymnn7cSqnvX4GzCVg.text: Amazing restaurant! Absolutely delicious. If you have a craving for Ethiopian food, Enat will ensure you leave satisfied!

photos.caption: Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Custom Ethiopian burrito

5h1R7-bSP2Yo3TMjychTqQ.text: Great food and service. Highly recommended-try the lamb tibs. Unbelievably good. I am from Chicago and my wife is African so we know good Ethiopian. This is it. Really like the whole place.

photos.caption: Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lamb tibs

ynOFI4h2jZRAeaSv0iFQ6g.text: Absolutely Amazing! The food here is always fresh  and fantastic! I love the vegetarian combo!

m77t9fTMesDfMUQvGv_1jg.text: Ordered from Postmates and one side was incorrect. They delivered it to my door, within 30 mins, hot and delicious. The entire meal was incredible, cooked and seasoned to perfection. Great food + Great Service = Happy Customer who will return. Thanks Enat!

a2O24sud7PErQk7KmuqIyg.text: This was amazing Ethiopian food. We ordered through Postmates and when it got here it was still hot and still delicious so I can only imagine how good it would be fresh from the kitchen in the restaurant

photos.caption: Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Veggie dish

eMvib7GWDkkVfOSt04RJdw.text: Came here with a group of about 15 for a monthly foodie outing and we had a great time. The place is really small and we practically took over the place. But the owner took great care of us and even walked us through the menu and gave us background information on the restaurant & it's name. The vegetarian combo with lamb on the side was delicious with the array of spices & the lamb was cooked to perfection. Everything is made fresh to order so everyone's plate came out as it was done. I don't think there was a person at the table that didn't enjoy their dish. The owners mother even came out and performed a coffee ceremony for us and it was a nice end to our meal. I will definitely be back!

XExpvKDWKDU3zBzcKQKrbA.text: Yummy!!! Amazing service and delicious food. I'd recommend having the cinnamon tea after your meal too. That was so relaxing.

18Uc1KPoA5QMSiGRjEJtnw.text: Soooooo.... delicious........ such a great menu, every dish is flavorful and robust. The coffee is such good quality. Reasonably priced friendly staff

YSM0kINhnx8q1MkJeqKkMg.text: Another pleasant Ethiopian experience - WOW, the food was so delicious!  The sambusas came to the table fresh from the grease and boy were they hot and delicious - 1 of each (beef, lentil, and chicken). The sauce which accompanied them was different, reminded me of a sweet Thai sauce.  The veggie platter - off the chain, and the crunchy lamb tibs - goodness.    You'll enjoy the food, as well as the friendly and beautiful staff.  Come on in!

photos.caption: Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sambusas
Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Enat
Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Front door...

hhzcpV_JLo-5Z-6hGyWrsw.text: We have really missed Ethiopian food since Meskerem closed several years ago.  We be heard great things about Enat (which means "mother"), and decided to make the drive to check them out.    First off, the servers couldn't have been nicer or more helpful.  They could tell we were new, and offered helpful suggestions on what to order.  We started with a combo of the chicken and lentil sambusas.  I thought I'd prefer the lentil, but I actually preferred the chicken.  Since the lentil was a tad spicier, my husband preferred them.  We had one large piece of enjera topped with the vegetarian combo, and my husband's lamb tibs.  Our favorites were the chickpeas, collards, cabbage, green beans, and lentils.  We preferred the hot over the cold items, and the only thing we didn't really like was the salad, since it was almost impossible to eat with enjera.  The portions were huge, and we couldn't eat it all.    We loved the food, and will return if we are in the area.

dk_TnYo5g0y0fjy_XsVzDw.text: Excellent Ethiopian cuisine.  I highly recommend this restaurant.  Beautiful presentation, clean restaurant and extremely friendly staff.  Delicious food!

photos.caption: Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

BD0Q_MqAWHdd6dHEQAHwvQ.text: This is my go to Ethiopian restaurant in Charlotte.  The food and service are consistent, I have yet to be disappointed. I happily drive quite a ways to dine here.  Ambience: Enat is small, but cute. And quite functional. There are about 9 tables total. No booth seating. There's also a to go counter up front. The walls are painted with saying and Ethiopian paintings are hanging. It sets the mood.   Service: The upside to such a quaint place is the attentive service. It's hard to get over looked. They are very accommodating and will answer and questions you may have. If it's your first time trying Ethiopian food, ASK QUESTIONS! They are eager to answer, and want to make your dining experience great.  The food (the best part): The owner is usually the one cooking. She's awesome. She'll take requests and modify your dishes accordingly. We always start with Sambusa. They are pastry pockets filled with beef or lentils (go with the lentils). I am a huge fan of trying Ethiopian hot tea, their's has more cinnamon and not as much cardamom and ginger. But it's still good.  I always order the fish tibs, cabbage and miser. It's amazing. Especially if you add the awaze sauce to the fish.   All in all, switch it up for once. Go try something new!

photos.caption: Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Veggie platter
Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fish tibs with awaze, cabbage and miser
Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sambusa

yoCWjYli4TjVt3kCZavPiA.text: The lamb was really great. I appreciate the care that is taken with the food. Most Ethiopian platters consists of mostly cooked items. I appreciate the fact that Enat's platters feature both cooked and fresh items.   It's definitely one of my recommended locations for authentic cuisine.

photos.caption: Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegetarian platter with Derek Tibs
Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegetarian platter with Derek Tibs

jSJzPsoJamw_MWZ5baVxmg.text: A simple but most pleasant place.  Good food, great service and reasonably priced.  I had the vegetarian platter and my wife had the lamb.  Both were tasty.  The vegetarian platter was huge.  Almost too much to reasonably eat in one sitting but my wife helped me.  This is the third Ethiopian restaurant we have been to in the Charlotte area and Enat is now our favorite.  If you are in the mood for Ethiopian food go here.  p.s. For those not familiar with Ethiopian restaurants- food is served family style (on a platter usually) with a spongy flatbread called injera/enjera.  Tradition has it that you tear off a piece of bread and pick up your food with it (traditionally with the right hand).  All the places we have been to offer silverware but who doesn't want to be a kid again and eat with your hands (smile).

cVES3fn_r9rjJEeovBMM-A.text: Craving something different I decided to make the drive over to The Plaza to check out Enat.  I placed my order through the yelp app and headed over.  I ordered the vegetarian combo without the enjera (remembering trying it before and not liking it).  The combo includes 9 samples of their vegan offerings and I was impressed with the majority of of them.  I also ordered the sabusa stuffed with lentils and they were amazing but very spicy and served with a great tasting sauce.  The restaurant is very small in a strip mall with other restaurants and stores.  The staff was very pleasant, and made sure I had everything I needed before leaving.  The size of the platter was pretty huge, even for my takeout order.

photos.caption: Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Veggie platter
Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lentil Sambusa&#39;s

UPqOyl7EC_lX_hDUea-yUQ.text: AMAZING!! Enat did not disappoint! We ordered the vegetarian platter. Misir wat is one of my favorite dishes and it was by far the best I've ever had! Get the Tej (honey wine)!!!! It is homemade and it is amazing!!! The staff are friendly and are always willing to answer questions if you are new to Ethiopian cuisine! If you are ever in Charlotte, this place is a must try!! I will definitely be back each time I visit the Queen City!!

_Xbmhd_YNHVIXo74Efv2CA.text: First time eating here and will definitely be back!! Friendly, helpful waitstaff answering all our questions and giving recommendations. We had the vegan option , which was flavorful and delicious as well as the Classic Tibs!! Highly recommend! You won't be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegan option and Classic tibs

1qFU1E8O90f-jyuKCewyTg.text: Passing through CLT and needed a place to break my fast.  Googled for etheopean food and right away hit this option.  Theb20 min drive was totally worth it.  Excellent veg platter and a very friendly staff.   Awesome experience.

GsNGxjpceTdF0ZUw8n1f1g.text: I've always been curious about Ethiopian food, but never went and ordered some until today. I placed my order on Postmates to have it delivered to my place. I got the vegan combo for $12. There was a nice variety of veggie dishes to try and tons of different flavors in this one dish. I was particularly fond of these darker lentils, not sure what dish it was. The lenitls had a subtle horseradish flavor to them. The meal came with plenty of spongy inerja bread to pick up the veggies with. I'll be sure to order from here again, it's a fresh change from greasy fast food. My only issue is the portions look bigger in the dine-in pics, but I don't know how large the plates are in reference to a takeout container.

photos.caption: Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegan combo to-go.

lbmhubTZ65D8xKOJwfjOew.text: I have been eating Ethiopian food for 30 years.  I have enjoyed Ethiopian in Colorado, Canada and Washington DC to name a few. My lunch today was easily some of the best I have ever had!  Enat is amazing.  The service was excellent and our waiter was very helpful in steering me towards dishes my kids might like.  My daughter loved it.  Especially the lamb and she turns her nose up at "fancy" Mac and cheese.  Great place!

7nSsZUf8XN54UR2PDuN2Og.text: First time eating Ethiopian and Enat did not disappoint. Everything was delicious!! We had chicken tibs, derek lamb tibs, regular lamb tibs , and lamb firfir with ater, azifa, and fosolia as sides. All of this was served family style on enjera. It was more than enough food for four people and we went home with two full takeout boxes. The menu might intimidate people that aren't fans of spicy food (lots of jalapenos and cayenne pepper), but we didn't find anything to be all that spicy.

6EWJffvtWqFb7KFpI9Pq9A.text: Simply AWESOME!! GREAT SERVICE, GREAT FOOD... I am a connoisseur of Ethiopian food wherever I travel; this place is TOP! visit and you won't be disappointed

photos.caption: Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lamb, Grouper,  Cabbage, &amp; Salad.. YUM YUM

iHXnns6PHOchmbnIi2Kicw.text: This place is what I have been dreaming of.  Here come the cliches and eyerolls.  There are hipsters, milenials, people speaking at least two different dialects, a waiter who makes you feel comfortable, and a very authentic feel.  I love the food.  I want to keep saying that but you will stop reading.  I hate beets, I ate a dish of beats I was neutral about.  Neutral for something I hate is an act if wizardy.  The things I didn't have ingredient wise I loved.  Money: you get plenty of perfect spongy bread included, you can buy more for $3, I didnt need to.  Usually I run out of bread, big shout out to the operators that understand Americans can't mentally handly paying for bread.  Portions are large enough I had leftovers and I was hungry when I rolled in.  I have vegan family and friends, I dread disappointing them.  The food here makes me happy and will make them happy.  I can even eat vegan and not cry myself to sleep.  My tongue and stomach won't mind it at all.  Get a sampler if you don't know the food.  They have a superior version of the samosa here, order it.  I always like tibs, i prefer crunchy but the saucy one is great too.  The food isn't too hot, you can makw your face melt or you can order no spicey.

U4iMPuwepDHI0E7aMBkDQQ.text: I'm still new to the Ethiopian food scene, but I am so glad I went to Enat! The staff was beyond helpful, I was honest with them and told them that I'd only had Ethiopian a couple of times prior and asked for some guidance through the menu.  First thing, they highly recommended we move to a larger table (due to the Ethiopian style playing and their portion sizes) even though there was just two of us - Good Call!  I had lamb Tibs - per the staff's recommendation - that was insanely well-flavored and I couldn't stop with the Injera!   After trying our hardest to eat everything on the table, we had to throw in the towel, but, I'll be back!   Enat was a great experience. I was very happy with the hospitality of the staff and that coupled with the delicious food and the portion sizes easily make this a 5-Star eatery!  If you are a long time fan of Ethiopian, or new to it. Go to Enat, ask for recommendations and sit back and enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu looks great! Friendly service, server was able to answer any questions we had about the menu!

ZDzgGiiru0NJ79U0fj1aXQ.text: Wow! First off everyone that works here is amazing! So nice and so patient explaining to new comers. There were 4 of us, we split family style the grouper, the lamb and the vegetarian platter. This was the perfect amount of food and we loved everything on the player. Please try this place, you won't be disappointed!!

photos.caption: Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Family style lamb, grouper and vegetarian platter. Fed 4 of us.

C1tRQhIP9-gus9-V-wb9Ww.text: We had the Enat special. It comes with the  Veggie firfir served with beef tibs, kitfo and ayib.   Veggie firfir was awesome. It's injera (sourdough sponge like flat bead) soaked in a lightly spicy sauce with tomatoes. Sooo good.  Beef tibs are pieces of ribeye meat seasoned Stirfry and stewed. It was nice and tender and so flavorful  Kitfo is African beef tartare mix with spicy buttery seasoning. You can have in a little bit cooked if you want. I like mine raw. Well done melts in your mouth.  Ayib is cottage cheese sprinkle on top.  If you like Indian food you would like African food without the curry or have a cinnamon spice  I've eaten at every Ethiopian restaurant in Charlotte and this place by far makes the best kitfo.   It is a nice cozy place with good service and good quality food. The veggie firfir put it over the top and earn the place a 5 stars.   If you've never eaten Ethiopian food I recommend you try the vegetarian dishes and the beef tips.

9yhiyuIhry10NocQH35NVg.text: My boyfriend and I were looking for something different and we both have never had Ethiopian food.  I was drawn to this place because if their vegeterian combo which is a sampling of all their vegan options.  This place seems like it is a nice, family run business.  Service was great.  I wish the water was colder than room temperature but it's not a big deal.  The food was delicious.  We got the sambusas with lentils and they came out piping hot with a nice dipping sauce.  I love the injera bread and the server brought more without us even asking which was awesome.  The vegetable plate was a sensory experience.  It was so colorful and each food tasted different.  My favorite was the cabbage.  I didn't care for the salad or tomato fitfit but everything else was great.  I definitely recommend trying this place out if you are vegan or looking for something different.

Xt0a372_iOdEqdN_uZH3Bg.text: OMG everything was so good. It was my first time eating Ethiopian food and the whole experience was excellent. The staff were so kind and helpful in explaining the dishes. They made us feel at home. I look forward to going again.

photos.caption: Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lamb
Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegetarian combo platter WOW
Photo of Enat Ethiopian Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sambusa - lentils.
